page.title: 04BASSINGBOURN BARRACKS
page.content: Travelling north along the A14 you come to the Barracks. This was built as an air base for the war but is now the depot of the Queen's Division. As you enter the Barracks you go through some barriers. There are two tanks either side which were used in World War II. There is a NAAFI shop that is used by army families, a ski slope and squash courts which are used by the public. The houses are up to 50 years old and laid out in four estates:{Edinburgh {Square, Oxford Close, Cardiff Place and{Cambridge Crescent.}All the work shops are by the airfield. The old tanks and guns are cleaned in them and are sent to Duxford air shows. Many children come by bus from the barracks to our school each day as fathers and trainees are posted here from other places and countries.
